Name: 基础小提琴图
Description: 使用手动创建数据的基础小提琴图

Name: Horizontal Violin Plot
Description: The x and y axes can be flipped using coord_flip()

Name: Violin Plot with Boxplot
Description: Box plot can be added to a violin plot using geom_boxplot()

Name: Grouped Violin Plot
Description: Achieve intra-group comparison by setting the fill value

Name: Half-Violin Plot
Description: Use the geom_half_violin function to display two groups separately

Name: Violin Plot Using the ggstatsplot Package
Description: The ggstatsplot package extends ggplot2 by adding powerful statistical visualizations

Name: Basic Density Plot
Description: Create a density plot using?geom_density

Name: Mirrored Density Plot
Description: Mirror density plot helps us intuitively compare the distributions of two datasets

Name: Multiple Groups Density Plot
Description: A multi-group density plot allows for an intuitive comparison of the distribution differences between different groups

Name: Faceted Density Plot
Description: Facet density plots for multiple variables, by displaying data from different groups in different panels

Name: Stacked Density Plot
Description: In a stacked density plot, the density distributions of different groups are stacked on top of each other

Name: Marginal distributions (density plots)
Description: Marginal distributions (density plots) can be drawn using the ggMarginal() function from the ggExtra package

Name: Annotated Density Plot
Description: Annotated density plots allow key information or group names to be displayed directly on the plot,

Name: Basic Histograms
Description: Basic histogram using geom_histogram()

Name: Histogram with Density Curve
Description: The density curve provides a smooth representation of the data distribution

Name: Mirrored Histogram
Description: A mirrored histogram provides an intuitive way to compare the distributions of two datasets

Name: Overlapping Histograms on the Same Axis
Description: Overlaying or placing multiple histograms side by side on the same axis enables a direct comparison of distributions for two or more datasets within the same coordinate system

Name: Faceted Histograms for Multiple Variables
Description: Faceted histograms provide a structured way to compare and analyze data across multiple variables or categorical groups by displaying them in separate panels

Name: Adding Marginal Distributions Using ggMarginal()
Description: Create a scatterplot with marginal histograms

Name: Basic Box Plot
Description: Create a box plot using geom_boxplot()

Name: Variable Width Boxplot
Description: Draw a variable width boxplot where the box width is proportional to the sample size by using the varwidth parameter.

Name: Boxplot for Continuous Variables
Description: Use the cut_width() function to divide the continuous variable into intervals and then draw the boxplot

Name: Boxplot with Mean Values
Description: Use the stat_summary() function to add the mean value for each group to the boxplot

Name: Scatter Boxplot
Description: Use the geom_jitter() function to add individual observations, allowing us to see the specific distribution of each group.

Name: Grouped Boxplot
Description: Use the fill parameter to draw grouped boxplots, which facilitates comparisons both between and within groups.

Name: Adding Marginal Distributions to Boxplots
Description: Adding marginal distributions on the X and Y axes

Name: Basic Ridgeline Plot
Description: Basic Violin Plot with iris Data

Name: Histogram Ridgeline Plots
Description: Histogram ridgeline plots are ideal for displaying data distributions and counts

Name: Ridgeline Plot with Variable Colors
Description: Colors can be assigned based on numerical variables instead of categorical ones

Name: Basic Beeswarm Plot
Description: Basic Beeswarm Plot with iris Data

Name: Flipping the Beeswarm Plot
Description: Flipping the beeswarm plot using horizontal=TRUE

Name: Changing Basic Features of Beeswarm Plot
Description: Key parameters of beeswarm plot

Name: Grouping Beeswarm Plot
Description: Using the ~ operator, we can easily create a grouped bee swarm plot

Name: Custom Position Behavior of Beeswarm Plot
Description: Changing the position behavior of the points can prevent overlap between groups

Name: Basic Beeswarm (ggbeeswarm package)
Description: Basic Beeswarm using ggbeeswarm package

Name: Flipping the Beeswarm Plot (ggbeeswarm package)
Description: Flipping the Beeswarm Plot using ggbeeswarm package

Name: Customization of the Beeswarm Plot (ggbeeswarm package)
Description: We can use the theme() function to change the color of the points and the overall theme of the chart

Name: Changing the Position of Points (ggbeeswarm package)
Description: We can change this behavior using the method parameter

Name: Customizing the Color of Points (ggbeeswarm package)
Description: We can use the scale_color_manual() function to customize the colors

Name: Grouping and Adding Statistical Analysis (ggbeeswarm package)
Description: Grouping and Adding Statistical Analysis using ggbeeswarm package

Name: Basic Scatter Plot
Description: Drawn Basic Scatter Plot by calling geom_point()

Name: Set Point Style
Description: Changed the shape, size, and color style of the points based on the basic scatter plot.

Name: Multi-class Data Plotting
Description: Use color=Species to map the species variable to the color feature, giving different species different colors.

Name: Map Categorical Variables to other Features
Description: Map the species variable to both color and shape, with different species having different colors and shapes.

Name: Change Legend Position
Description: Places the legend in the blank space of the chart, making it more aesthetically pleasing.

Name: Add Point Labels
Description: Use geom_text() to draw point labels

Name: Draw Regression Curve
Description: A regression curve using geom_smooth(), which is a common form in articles.

Name: Add Labels to Regression Curve
Description: Uses geom_labelsmooth() to add labels to the regression curve.

Name: Add Marginal Rug Plots
Description: Use geom_rug() to add marginal rugs.

Name: Add Marginal Distributions
Description: The marginal distribution of histograms, and multiple parameters can be used to adjust the style of the marginal plots.

Name: Basic R Heatmaps
Description: https://openbiox.github.io/Bizard/Correlation/Heatmap.html#basic-heatmap

Name: lattice Heatmaps
Description: The lattice package provides the levelplot() function for constructing heatmaps

Name: complexheatmap Heatmaps
Description: The ComplexHeatmap package, based on the grid package, uses an object-oriented approach to implement heatmaps and their components

Name: GGally Package
Description: GGally is a commonly used tool for drawing correlation diagrams. It allows the injection of ggplot2 code but does not have a sorting function

Name: corrplot Package
Description: The corrplot package is a commonly used tool for correlation visualization, which has powerful customization functions and a sorting function

Name: ggcorrplot Package
Description: The ggcorrplot package is equivalent to a simplified version of the corrplot package, mainly including the calculation function of cor_pmat and the plotting function of ggcorrplot

Name: corrgram Package
Description: The corrgram package is also a good choice for drawing correlation diagrams. It can select the content to be displayed in the upper, lower, and diagonal parts.

Name: Basic Venn Diagram
Description: Plot basic venn diagram using ggVennDiagram()

Name: Beautify the Venn diagram
Description: The color of the set in ggVennDiagram is a continuous variable set according to the number of elements contained in the set.

Name: VennDiagram
Description: Draw Venn diagrams using the VennDiagram package

Name: Basic Upset Plot
Description: This basic Upset graph shows the number of movies that contain different elements.

Name: Personalized Upset Plot
Description: In terms of image color, the UpSetR package provides multiple parameters to set the color of different parts of the Upset image

Name: Advanced Upset Plot
Description: Use the queries parameter

Name: Biological Data Example
Description: The dataset uses the df_complex_conditions dataset in the ggupset package

Name: Basic Collinearity Plot
Description: You can use the ideogram function provided in the RIdeogram package to draw a collinearity plot.

Name: Change Collinearity Plot Colors
Description: If you want to change the colors of the plot, just modify the color column in the karyotype and overlaid tables

Name: Gene Structure Plot
Description: As an extension of ggplot2, gggenes consists of a main function geom_gene_arrow and several secondary functions.

Name: Gene Structure Plot Beautification
Description: Beautification of gene structure plot

Name: qqman draws Manhattan plot
Description: Manhattan and qq are the two most important functions in qqman, responsible for drawing Manhattan graphs and QQ graphs respectively

Name: ggplot2 draws manhattan plot
Description: The advantage of using ggplot2 to draw a Manhattan map is that the style of the image can be highly customized.

Name: Basic Multiple Volcano Plot
Description: Multiple volcano plots can be drawn using the jjVolcano function provided in the scRNAtoolVis package.

Name: Direction rotation of Multiple Volcano Plot
Description: Use the flip parameter in the jjVolcano function to rotate the orientation of the heatmap.

Name: Polar Coordinates of Multiple Volcano Plot
Description: Convert multiple volcano plots to polar coordinates by setting the parameter polar = T.

Name: Build Network Plot
Description: Simple multi-omics network: contains information of microbiome, metabolome, transcriptome, etc.

Name: Add Annotation to Nework Plot
Description: Add annotation to nework plot using c_net_set()

Name: Filter Subnetwork
Description: Filter subnetwork using c_net_filter()

Name: Merge Network
Description: Merge network using c_net_union()

Name: Sankey Bubble plot
Description: Draw sankey bubble plot

Name: Basic Volcano Plot
Description: Draw basic volcano plot

Name: Labeled Volcano Plot
Description: Add label to volcano plot
